text: Whenever dharma declines and the purpose of life is forgotten, I manifest myself on earth. I am born in every age to protect the good, to destroy evil, and to reestablish dharma.
As they approach me, so I receive them. All paths, Arjuna, lead to me.
I am the beginning, middle, and end of creation.
I am time, the destroyer of all; I have come to consume the world.
There are three gates to hell: lust, anger, and greed. Renounce these three.
You have the right to work, but never to the fruit of work.
Fill your mind with me; love me; worship me always.
The soul is eternal, indestructible, and immeasurable.
Just as a person discards worn-out clothes and puts on new ones, the soul discards old bodies and enters new ones.
Weapons cannot cut the soul, fire cannot burn it.
Cold and heat, pleasure and pain come and go; endure them.
The wise are not disturbed by pleasure or pain.
Action is better than inaction.
All actions are performed by the modes of nature.
One who controls the senses with the mind is superior.
Sacrifice performed without desire leads to liberation.
There is nothing as purifying as spiritual knowledge.
Doubtless knowledge cuts ignorance to pieces.
One who sees action in inaction is wise.
Renunciation and selfless action both lead to freedom.
The wise see with equal vision a learned person and an outcaste.
One who is inwardly joyful attains liberation.
Let a person lift themselves by their own mind.
The mind can be a friend or an enemy.
Yoga is moderation in eating, sleeping, and working.
A steady mind is achieved through practice and detachment.
Among yogis, the devoted one is the highest.
I am the taste in water.
I am the seed of all beings.
Those deluded by the modes do not seek me.
Four kinds of people worship me.
Those who worship with devotion dwell in me.
Fix your mind on me and you will reach me.
Whatever one remembers at death, that they attain.
The imperishable Brahman is the supreme goal.
I sustain all beings but am not dependent on them.
Those who worship me with devotion lack nothing.
Even a sinner becomes righteous by devotion.
Offer whatever you do to me.
I am the source of all spiritual and material worlds.
I am the self seated in the hearts of all beings.
Among mountains, I am Meru.
There is no end to my divine manifestations.
With one fragment of myself I sustain the universe.
Behold my universal form.
I am time, the great destroyer.
Neither hatred nor attachment defines my devotee.
One who is friendly and compassionate is dear to me.
The path of devotion is easiest.
I support this entire universe.
Humility and nonviolence are true knowledge.
Nature and soul are beginningless.
The knower of the field attains immortality.
Goodness binds through happiness and knowledge.
One who transcends the modes is freed.
The supreme person is beyond decay.
Cut down the tree of illusion with detachment.
Divine qualities lead to liberation.
Anger arises from desire.
Faith determines a person’s nature.
Austerity of speech is truthful and gentle words.
Renunciation born of ignorance is tamasic.
Knowledge, action, and doer are threefold.
Better one’s own duty than another’s.
By devotion one truly knows me.
Abandon all duties and surrender to me.
I will free you from all sins.
This knowledge should not be given to the faithless.
One who teaches this is most dear to me.
Where Krishna and Arjuna stand, there is victory.
In this world, there is nothing so purifying as knowledge. One who has reached perfection in yoga finds this knowledge within themselves.
A person who is not disturbed by the incessant flow of desires—who has renounced all desires—can attain peace.
Man is made by his belief. As he believes, so he is.
The soul is neither born, and nor does it die
You came empty-handed, and you will leave empty-handed.
One who has control over the mind is tranquil in heat and cold, in pain and pleasure, and in honor and dishonor.
When meditation is mastered, the mind is unwavering like the flame of a lamp in a windless place.
A person who is not envious but who is a kind friend to all living entities, who is free from all fear, and whose heart is filled with compassion, is said to possess divine qualities.
The wise see the same truth in every living being, and in that wisdom, they see the unity of the divine.
Surrender all your works to me, with full knowledge of the self. Without selfishness, without ego, fight the battle.
A person who does not desire material things, whose mind is free from attachments, who sees the divine presence in everything, achieves peace.
Perform your duties with sincerity and without attachment to the results. This will lead to inner peace.
The one who has reached self-realization is unaffected by pain and pleasure.
In this world, there is no one more sinful than a person who causes harm to others.
The soul is eternal. It neither kills nor can be killed.
Everything is born of me, and everything moves in me. Nothing exists without me.
When your mind is free from distractions and desires, you will find the divine presence in everything.
The path of devotion is the easiest way to reach the supreme reality. One who surrenders completely attains liberation.
You are what you believe in. You become that which you believe you can become.
The one who has conquered himself is a true conqueror, and the one who conquers the world is not.
With the sword of wisdom, cut the doubts that bind your heart. With a steady mind, live in peace.
A true yogi sees the divine presence in all beings and does not make distinctions between people.
There is no greater worship than serving others with a pure heart and mind.
The wise do not grieve for the living or the dead.
The one who is devoted to the Supreme Lord and has given up all material attachments will achieve eternal peace.
The three qualities of nature—goodness, passion, and ignorance—control all beings. The one who transcends these qualities is free from birth and death.
He who sees me in all beings, and all beings in me, will never be separated from me, and I will never be separated from him.
Actions do not bind me. They are merely expressions of the divine will.
The one who is free from attachment, without desires, and without fear, is the true yogi.
You are what you believe yourself to be.
In truth, there is no distinction between the creator and the created. All is the divine play of God.
The path of knowledge leads to liberation, but it is not an easy path for those who are still attached to worldly desires.
When the mind is fixed on the divine, it is impossible for it to be distracted by material desires.
True freedom comes from the realization that the soul is eternal and is unaffected by the cycles of birth and death.
Do your work with love and devotion, without expecting any reward, and you will attain the supreme goal.
The wise person sees the same reality in a learned priest, a cow, an elephant, and even a dog.
He who has no attachment to the fruits of his work and is free from desires is a true yogi.
The one who surrenders all actions to the divine, with a mind detached from material desires, will be free from the bonds of karma.
No one who is devoted to me will ever be destroyed.
I am the light of the sun, and the moon, and the fire; I am the essence of all that is.
The person who has a pure heart and is free from desire will see the divine presence in all living beings.
The one who has mastered the senses and desires, and whose mind is detached from worldly pursuits, is a true yogi.
It is better to do one's own duty imperfectly than to do another's duty perfectly.
Those who seek liberation should transcend the body and the mind and live in the eternal self.
The one who is free from the dualities of pain and pleasure, heat and cold, and other such opposites, remains unshaken in all circumstances.
When you give up selfish desires and work for the good of others, you will find the peace you seek.
It is the nature of the soul to be eternal and unchanging.
A yogi sees the divine presence in all beings and is detached from worldly desires.
The self is never destroyed. It is eternal and indestructible.
